channel.title: Hopefully last C4D help needed
channel.description: Just wondering is there a way to but sumthing out instead of building it side by side, like making a hallow box by deleting the middle

item.title: Hopefully last C4D help needed
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“maru, post:3, topic:129291”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=179908.msg1644924#msg1644924 date=1186013770]
Yes.

Just press C to make it editable

Select faces, and then get the selection tool click the face you want to delete and press the Delete key…
[/quote]

It depends, because then you’re stuck with a thin box. If you wanted to make something like a wooden box, you’d want some thickness on the edges. The easiest way to go about that would be using a boole, however, they are resource hogging if you use them a lot.

Make it editable, and delete the polygons you want rid of. Then go to Structure menu, and there are loads of tools that help you.[/quote]

Yes when I want a little thickness I use boole, but you can also use the knife tool…

Read full topic

item.title: Hopefully last C4D help needed
item.dc:creator: @maru maru
item.description:
@maru wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:2, topic:129291”]Yes.

Just press C to make it editable

Select faces, and then get the selection tool click the face you want to delete and press the Delete key…[/quote]

It depends, because then you’re stuck with a thin box. If you wanted to make something like a wooden box, you’d want some thickness on the edges. The easiest way to go about that would be using a boole, however, they are resource hogging if you use them a lot.

Make it editable, and delete the polygons you want rid of. Then go to Structure menu, and there are loads of tools that help you.

Read full topic
